description: Canonical example of the normalized instruction dataset structure used across all BookGen AI domains.

example.input: Walk through how a data scientist should evaluate drift in a production model.
example.output: Start by instrumenting the production scoring service to log predictions with relevant features and timestamps. Compute population stability index (PSI) between training and production distributions weekly; a PSI above 0.25 indicates significant drift. Complement PSI with KL divergence for continuous features. When drift is detected, trigger a retraining workflow using the latest labelled data and update model cards with the monitoring results.
